page.title: 10LEISURE TIME IN SCHOOL
page.content: In the playground we sometimes play 'Sharks'. It is a game played with lots of people. We usually play it between two walls. One person is on 'it' and they call someones name, e.g. Lucy.So Lucy would have to try and run to the other side without being caught. If she gets caught she would be on 'it' with the other person, but if she gets across then the rest of us have to run across. If the person who is on 'it' calls 'Sharks'that means we all try to get across to the other side, and the person on 'it' can catch as many people as they can. As more people get caught the game becomes harder, as there is more than one person on 'it'. We play lots of other games in the playground, but I enjoy this one the most. STANLEY SCHOOL
